Nice place. Food was very bland.  The pastrami was chewy. Fries not worth it. The service was good. The restaurant was not noisy.
I went in for a bagel and let me tell you their veggie cream cheese is to die for ! Super good !!

I ordered the Monte Christo sandwich. Now I've had Monti Cristos in many locations and this is the only one that was not really a Monte Cristo. Basically it was a ham and turkey sandwich that was fried. No egg wash no nothing.  No preserves or jelly and the potatoes served with it were rock hard. The service sucked big time.

Great, friendly service.

Loved the potato latkes for breakfast.  And the bagel!  Mmmm... I'm a carb girl.
Best pastrami Reuben on the planet! The corned beef one was just as good but that pastrami is still on my brain. Def gotta taste it in your lifetime!
This place is fantastic. I've had both the Scottwich and the Philly Cheesesteak, both are great- but the Scottwich is to die for! I also loved their Linzer cookies...yum!

I am so happy that I found this place! I've always been into the deli scene, but had never heard of this place. Coincidentally, I had recently watched Man vs. Food and When Harry Met Sally, both of which were filmed (at one point in time) at Katz's in NYC. At this point something deep inside of me craved top-notch pastrami or corned beef. 

The next thing I know I'm browsing stores in a strip and come across Scott's. I had a very tough time deciding but I went with the Reuben; not just any Reuben though, but a combination with pastrami and corned beef. I truly feel that I could not have made a better choice for my first visit because it was one epic Reuben. It was unbelievably rich and juicy. The meats worked extremely well together, especially when accompanied by the Russian dressing. Combined with fries, pickles and slaw, this was a meal fit for a Jewish king (oh, and the server was great; really relaxed and accommodating)!

Since reading reviews here on Yelp, I'll probably come visit again the next time I'm awake on the weekend early enough for breakfast. My first experience here was pretty astounding compared to most places; I even got free bagels on the way out the door! Go to this place and enjoy it!

Disappointing deli. The place just seemed dirty. Has the menu been replaced in a decade? No Kreplach. The chicken broth in the matzoh ball soup was of poor flavor and dilute. My daughter wouldn't even eat it.

The tuna and egg salads were pretty good but we did not get the sides that were advertised with the dishes and the tomato in which the tuna was stuffed was hard and flavor-less. The waitress must have made 20 trips to get us everything in our order and we didn't request any substitutions.

This is not a kosher-style deli either. Plenty of bacon and ham on the menu.

I would have given this a 1-star but other ratings indicated that some of the meatier items were satisfactory and I did not get a chance to try those. Unfortunately, I won't since I'm unlikely to return.

I was really excited to see this place being from Detroit.  It's like a mom and pop back east!  The food was great!  Loved the food selections.  Waitress was a nice lady.  All the stuff behind the deli counter looked delish!  I will come back for bagels next time my work has an event.  They looked really good!  I had the pastrami, coleslaw and a pickle.  Sooo good!  Not super salty like cheap pastrami!  Go here!

We have had this deli on our list of Food Network places so thought we'd come in for lunch. Aside from the old decor, dirty walls, dusty picture frames everywhere, and blurry TV's, we hoped for delicious food. My husband ordered the corned beef and pastrami sandwich and I ordered the corned beef hash scramble with a bagel and cream cheese. The corned beef was wonderful but so overcooked in my scramble. Tough little bits of meat in the way overcooked eggs. I had to add salt and pepper and it was still tough and bland. SAD! The bagel was over toasted and tough. The sandwich on rye was very GOOD but his home fries were so overcooked, they were tough and inedible. 
Our waitress was a wonderful, very old woman who took great care of us!
Overall, we will not come back and feel so sad. We prefer to patronize local businesses but will cross this one off our list. :-(

I ordered an omelet with ham, peppers, onions, and cheese. The omelet was decent but a little greasy - and could have used some thicker chunks of ham. The side of potatoes and challah toast were pretty good.

Service was good, and it seems like a nice enough place. I may be back next time I'm looking for an early nearby breakfast.

well i stick to 4 stars for lunch all though that was my 1st time but the wife and i went for  breakfast last sunday morn. after the traditional being ignored for the first 8 minutes( BECAUSE WERE A NEW YORK STYLED DELI AND THATS THE WAY THEY DO IT IN NEW YORK) we sat down at a nice sized comfy booth our server a very nice older gal came and took our order cornbeef hash/breakfast burrito for the wife the cbh was fair (black bear diner has better and thats sad) burrito ok not great . there was 1 employ maybe a owner behind the counter defenitly from ny.........who cares .....sneezing, blowing his nose and then continuing to make the deli tray he was working on w/out washin his hands oh and then rubbing his nose with his finger as well lucky our meals were coming out of the kitchen and not from the front of the house where the 45 yo child does'nt know he needs to wash his hands when he blows his nose and is working w/food
Well thought I'd try it and probably won't be back. $15 for a roast beef sandwich when Tony's up the street has far superior meat quality and larger sandwich for $7. Disappointed.

Huge disappointment for breakfast. Ordered the skillet with chorizo and cheese. Not a skillet, more like scrambled eggs with chorizo, folded omelette style. Then topped off with two slices of Kraft American cheese. The slices were still square. The breakfast potatoes were mushy in a bad way. 

With all the breakfast options in this area you'd think this would be better.

Size of the pastrami sandwiches I'm used to from the east coast!
 And you can get knishes!

I'm going to do something I've never done before with this review. I'm going to actually review while eating the food for the very first time. That's right, I just got home from Scott's Generation after waking up on a girlfriend's couch with a brutal hangover and a huge craving for matzo ball soup and chopped liver. I picked up a to-go order, and they're sitting in front of me right now, eagerly awaiting my noshing session.

Right now, Scott's Generation is happily sitting at 5 stars. The employee handling my to-go order was awesome and seemed amused at my hangover remedy. Despite the fact that I love challah like a brother and could eat chopped liver for breakfast lunch and dinner, my parents insist I am not of Jewish heritage. However, there's never been an official paternity test, so I'm still holding out hope. On to the food!

The soup is fantastic! Lots of chunky veggies and chicken in a very tasty broth. The matzo balls are large with good texture. I would prefer a bit more seasoning, but I won't deduct a star because for all I know I'm just an Italian schmuck who doesn't know what a true matzo ball should taste like. But yeah, seasoning is good.

Opening my bagel chips and...wtf? Is that a cinnamon raisin bagel chip! Sorry, deducting a star. Bagel chips are for soups and spreads. I don't care who you are, nobody wants a raisin in their soup. Throw them out!  Eating the chopped liver and....giving the star back! It's delicious and I haven't even mixed in any onion!  I don't think I realized how dense a half pound of chopped liver would be, I kind of wish I would have got some rye for a sandwich. Sorry, internal monologue creeping into review, I'll stop that now.

Five stars for my first ever present-tense review! I can't wait to go back to Scott's to try the rest of their (very large) menu! Though for this trip, I'm glad I got out when I did. I was half drunk and the rainbow cookies were calling my name. I'll sober up first next time.

I should have followed my instinct to leave after seeing that page after page of the book-like laminated menus were caked with dried condiments and mystery foods.  Really gross!!!  

The chicken broth in the chicken noodle and matzoh ball soups was too thin and the matzoh ball was awful. -- small, hard, and with an off taste.  Deli sandwiches were OK.   Waitress was very nice.

Sorry to say that will be both my first and last time dining there.

I have to say that Scott's is simply the real thing as far as Jewish style deli's in Phoenix.  I ordered the corn beef and matza ball soup.  It was quite delicious.  The atmosphere is one of a deli with both intimate and group seating available.

The service is excellent with an extensive menu.  

Enjoy........

Best breakfast sandwich ever! I may be biased because 1) I love bacon, egg and cheese sandwiches on a fresh made everything bagel almost more than life itself and 2) any legit east coast, Jewish deli, complete with that East Coast attitude makes me feel like home... But seriously, their bagels are amazing, they fry their eggs to order perfectly (easy, medium, hard), and the cheese is a perfect consistency every time! I've also had their brisket sandwich and their pastrami - both of which do not disappoint in any way shape or form. 

Scott's is definitely my go to when I want a little taste of the East Coast!

Way overpriced.  There sub should be priced at 6.50 tops.  It's just okay at best.  Their pickle taste like its been marinated in salt.  The worse part about it was that my buddy wanted to go somewhere else but we went to this place on my suggestion.  Fortunately, there was no rift caused in our friendship.

I'm so glad I finally tried this.  It was nice inside and friendly employees.  My husband got the chicken salad on white bread and did not like it.  Said it was just chicken and mayo.  However,  my Scottwich was so wonderful that I still gave 5 stars. That was hands down some of the most incredible pastrami I've ever had!!! There was so much I couldn't actually bite the full sandwich so I took half off and saving it for lunch tomorrow. Whatever the garlic rye they used is out of this world.

The New Yorker is delicious and huge I couldn't finish it. Absolutely love this place it's definitely going to be one of my new favorites. The lady who took my order was so sweet great customer service is always a plus.

Going to Scott's for 30 yrs.bkfst this am w/sister, she ordered hash,potato & OE eggs,n'toast. Now me, having lived in Brooklyn ordered latkas,onion bialy,grilled & sour creme,Apple sauce AND...
GRAPE JELLY. Nirvana in every bite. Love,love,love Scott's Generation,7th ST &
GLENDALE. you really gotta go,really,really LOL

Scott's Generations Restaurant & Delicatessen is New York Style Jewish type of deli and is well known for serving  over sized deli sandwiches and breakfast all day. They are NOT KOSHER but Jewish style. They also offer deli take items. One of the things that sets this New York Style Deli Restaurant above the others is the selection of smoked fish they offer. I'm not aware of any similar restaurants that offer really expensive Sturgeon or Sable smoked fish. They also offer the better tasting hard-to come-by Belly Lox and a few other fish you don't find at other restaurants.

One of my favorite plates to get here is the Smoked Fish Platter. They say it serves one person but I get two meals out of it. It comes with delicious crisp deli pickle spears, some veggies, a correct size bagel, cream cheese, potato salad, cole slaw and three selections of smoked fish. I really like it and I can't get it anywhere else!

Most of the time the Pastrami is better tasting than from many of the other New York Style restaurants. Usually it's that just right seasoning and seems the most similar to an east coast taste, not too much smoke with extra black pepper and is very tasty. Also not too lean and not too fatty....and you have to get it on that double cooked Rye Bread. I did notice that once in a blue moon they do get in an off batch that is not as flavorful but still better than from an average sandwich shop that uses Boars Head Brand.

I've tried the knish....it's good and  better tasting than from an other popular spot...but not the kind that is east cost bakery rom my memory...........I do like it  since it's better than from another spot. but I's not my memory.

Service is usually quick and efficient.

This new location is bright, shiny and clean looking.

After you watch the movie "Deli Man" you will have a new appreciation and an unbelievable hunger for Deli Food.

The last 4 delis i've been to didn't make the cut for pastrami & fish.

Scott's decor is a little old and tired but the restaurant earned a current grade "A" Maricopa Health Inspection.

When I looked at the menu I saw many items I haven't seen on other deli menus including a very large selection of smoked fish.

I ordered the smoked fish supreme platter. I got fresh hand carved Nova Scotia, White Fish and Lake Sturgeon that came with many sides and a bagel. They do have belly lox on the menu but were out of it. The hand carved Nova was very good and maybe the best you can find anywhere. The white fish was outstanding. You can't find better anywhere. I thought the sturgeon was good but I don't have much exsperience eating sturgeon because it's normally about $70.00 a pound so I haven't eaten that much. The potato salad and the cole slaw had good flavors but were a little drippy. The pickle was really great and above average. The everything bagel was really different but good. It was almost like a very oniony onion bagel with also with the everything toppings and was really packed with flavor. My platter was very large and I took enough home for another meal.

My husband ordered a triple decker sandwich with turkey pastrami and corned beef. The turkey tasted like fresh roasted. The corned beef was good. The pastrami taste very similar to what regular pastrami taste like back east. It had the right amount of fat and the correct flavors. The sandwich platter came with a mountain of crispy fries that might have been fresh cut red potatoes with several tasty pickles and fresh coleslaw.

After I watched the movie "Deli Man" I learned that Deli's have the highest food cost of all restaurants because they sell mostly meat so it isn't the cheapest food because it can't be.  But really the thing that struck me the most was that there are no more immigrants that bring over the recipes. 

From what I tried already Scott's Food is very Good and I don't feel the need to look for another deli.

See the "Deli Man" Movie and support a Deli!

A Jewish girl walks into a (oh, wait, I am writing a restaurant review and not a J.A.P. joke)....

When Scott's first opened many years ago, it was really good and had a lot more competition than it does now. In those days, there was Katz Deli, several Miracle Mile locations, Chompie's and a few other ill fated places (anyone remember Hollywood Deli?). I currently live in one of the best food meccas of the West Coast and can't get really good Jewish deli (Saul's is not great folks, and no, I have not tried Miller's yet). 

When Mom and Grandma picked me up from the airport, I had suggested we stop at Scott's to give them a try on the way to Sun City. None of us had been there in several years and I was really excited at a prospect for a delicious hot pastrami sandwich on rye. We got there, walked in and I noticed that the place itself looked a bit run down and dare I say, a little dirty? The owners are the same but the guy behind the counter who used to be friendly and Hamish just sat there like a schlub. We were directed to a table, and I immediately noticed how large their menu was. I ordered my sandwich sadly assuming that my regular hot pastrami would be (a) HOT and (b) on Karsh's rye since Karsh's is right next door. Neither was the case when my sandwich arrived and the pastrami was not delicious and I asked the waitress if I was mistakenly given the "lean" type of pastrami and she said I was not. Mom had a tongue sandwich and thought it was "okay" but she is not as picky (bitchy) as I am and Grandma had blintzes which did not look homemade but that of the frozen variety (I hope I am wrong here). Service was fair. Not warm and not quite the NY attitude that passes in these types of establishments.

After our experience I will no longer suggest Scott's and will have them drive directly to Chompie's.

This place is not good at all. We had horrible service the entire time we were there and it wasn't very busy. It took forever to get our food. Our waitress asked me if I wanted sour cream with the potato pancake, I said I did. Then she brought it without sour cream. It took another ten minutes to get the sour cream and I had to ask three different people for it before I finally got it. She then brought me the wrong sandwich and then it took another 20 minutes to get the correct one. 

I didn't think a deli could mess up a Reuben sandwich but they did. The pastrami was literally flavorless. Honestly the Reuben at Arby's has more flavor. The only good thing we had was the potato pancake.

We saw this place on Check Please Arizona and thought we'd give it try, we will not be going back.

This place is unreal.  I was in Phoenix for the weekend and had memories of hanging out with my friend Scott who used to live here.  I got on yelp to find a breakfast place and Scott's popped up.  This is as old school as it gets outside of the Northeast.  The waittresses are awesome, the food is amazing and I really can't say anything that hasn't already been said.

I don't make it to Phoenix much, but anytime I'm in town I'll be visiting Scott's.
Great breakfast and lunch options.  I appreciate having a quality deli here in the central phoenix area.

Love this place, it's the closest thing to a New York Deli that you will find in Arizona. The food is very good and the portions are large. I'm not a huge dessert person but the cheesecake is a MUST try. Best cheesecake I have ever had, compares to eating cheesecake straight from New York. A+
What gives.  I was there for 5 minutes while waiters just pass my by.  Just had to leave.  Maybe it's just profiling.

I can only comment on the breakfast although I'd like to come back for lunch as the deli seemed great.  I had the Kelly's "American" toast which is french toast made with challah, and a side of bacon.  The french toast was too much for even my heavyweight appetite to consume.  It was very tasty, richer and chewier because of the challah.  The bacon was thick, high-quality meaty bacon.  Not a fan of the orange juice, definitely from concentrate.  Also, I don't care for eating on or drinking from plastic as you do here.  I'm not a germaphobe, but it seems like it wouldn't get as clean.  

Very casual, seat yourself.  Don't be put off if you walk in and don't see any tables by the deli.  Look to your right.  There's a whole other room where we found plenty of seating.  We enjoyed looking at some of the photos on the wall, all taken in New York.  Would come again if in the neighborhood.

Amazing. I have eaten a lot of Reuben sandwiches...this was the best I've had outside of NYC. Loaded with juicy corned beef,  served with hand cut fries, and arguably the best cole slaw I've had anywhere and I'm from the south. A couple of my friends also had great sandwiches that we all kept ooohing and ahhhing over. I've eaten at chompie's, and this place is much better quality for the money. Also, they have house made pickles that are very tasty. I can't wait to go back, and bring my  hubby. My only complaint is that they aren't open later than 5!

From the time I walked in, after a 14 hour shift as a cardiac nurse, to the time I left, there was not a single smile or  "good morning". I went to get coffee from Tres Leches Cafe next door and then to grab some food from the deli on the way out. I bought a breakfast burrito and a vegetable omelet and paid $18. The only thing positive about the experience was the amazing coffee next door. Even the owner/manager barely looked up to smile or greet a customer. Just really strange customer service--almost like they didn't want the business. By the time my friend and I finally sat down to eat, we both agreed it was basic, mediocre food. I will not be going back to them anytime soon.
Our family wanted to thank Tony for providing a Great Passover meal for a single Dad with kids. Everyone was very happy and filled. Love you guys..
This place is a rathole.  Dirty, filthy floors and counters.  Slow service, not worth the effort to stop.

I get into these wild food moods where Ill wake up and have a craving for something, its usually pretty specific, this particular morning it was corned beef. Sounds crazy but once I get it in my head I wont be satisfied until I give into my cravings. I wasn't hungry though for just any corned beef, it had to be Boar's Head brand, aside from a few grocery stores the only place you can get Boar's Head is a good delicatessen. I knew just where to go, Scott's!

Situated between an Ace Hardware and a Basha's, this seems hardly the spot for a tasty sandwich. Let me tell you, they serve up massive tasty sandwiches with thick piled meat on your choice of bread and they have choices. Feeling helpless and at complete mercy to my urges I ordered Scott's Perfect Reuben-Reuben ($11.50). So tall you cant get your mouth around it, its stuffed with corned beef, swiss cheese and sauerkraut then grilled to a crispy buttery goodness.

When the server set my sandwich in front of me my eyes widened, it was a thing of beauty and desire. As I managed my sandwich for the first bite, I felt the wafts of hot corned beef beckoning, eat me, eat me. Enjoying bite after satisfying bite, my morning craving was quickly becoming fulfilled like an ancient prophecy. Ordering a side of Russian dressing to dunk my fries into may sound slightly odd but after one dip I think you'll agree, its perfectly natural.

For the health conscious who are rolling their eyes at my delicious choices, Scott's does offer lighter fare such as salads, soup and half sandwiches. However, I for one don't go to Scott's to eat light, I go to Scott's eat well.
I understand that Inspectors found 20 cockroaches under the sink at Scott's Generations. Lovely

Well, we went back for a 2nd time, & this will be the last time we go to Scott's Deli.... It was over 100 degrees today and the AC was not working...It was VERY warm in the restaurant which made our dining experience pretty miserable.  They had all of their ceiling fans on at full blast in the backroom which dried up my contact lenses & our napkins would keep flying off the table. We got the Greek Omellete and the cucumbers in it were bitter...had to take them all out. The waiter never even said 'I'm sorry"......
 I am from LA and there are faaar better Deli's there than here in Phoenix! 
This deli was pretty average, nothing like Jerry's Deli, or Canter's Deli in LA....NOW we're talkin'!  
On a side note, I am so sick & tired of ALWAYS seeing sports on TV's in restaurants! ...Okay for sports bars, or maybe Applebee's, but it is like everywhere you go! It would be refreshing to actually see a movie playing on a TV at a restaurant....Something that the whole family can enjoy watching, just saying. :)

Setting right next to a kosher bakery you gotta try the deli next door!  Super Ruben and nice people!  Toss-up whether its better then Chompies but nonetheless it holds its own in a niche market in Phoenix!  Give it a try.

Being from the east coast it is nice to have something that reminds me of home!  Great food and a little attitude! lol  Bagels are really good and one of the only places I know of in Phoenix to get a good knish!  The deli sandwiches are stacked with high quality meat!
Good food, good service. The French fries are something you are going to want to pass on.

I am recently recovered from a cold. It started in my head and has moved to my chest. While the cough has held on, I credit Scott's Generations (and Nyquil) for the bulk of my speedy recovery!

There's nothing like a flavorful broth and your choice of noodle, rice, matzo ball, or (my choice) kreplach for a miracle cure. A full quart'll set you back around $8. 

Even better: you don't have to be sick to enjoy this place. 

I also like Scott's for breakfast. Excellent corned beef hash. Plus, the whole diner feel and a good, chewy bagel has the potential to transport you to parts East.

Though the corn beef was lean and so delicious. The rye bread was stale. Ugh hope this will not be the case going forward. No one came and asked how the food was during our meal. Will give them one more chance. Cause that corn beef is great

Don't get between me and the smoked fish platter. This out of date deli with its oversized booths and the ancient wait staff is the best. There isn't a thing on the menu I haven't enjoyed and then spent the next week trying to burn off. My last visit for brunch caused me to calorie restrict for the rest of the day and most of the next. If Scott's were the only restaurant I could go to, I would be a happy, sated, fat man.

Scott's Generations Restaurant & Deli is probably the best delicatessen in the Phoenix market!  They are conveniently located at North 7th Street and Missouri and a strip center with an Ace Hardware and Basha's.

I met some Yelper's friends, Rand H., Robyn N., and Mike C. for a UYE some weeks ago here for lunch.  The restaurant is bigger than what it looks like from the outside.  It's a very clean place with plenty of celeb pics on walls from their prior visits to Scott's.  

The service was very good.  Our server was exceptional at keeping our drinks filled and serving.  

I had a hot pastrami on rye with a side or potato salad and coleslaw.  The pastrami sandwich was HUGE and it rated a 7 on a 1-5 scale for taste!!  I bet it weighed over 1lb by it's self.  It was full of pastrami-goodness with a hint of dressing that tasted fantastic!  It was one of the best pastrami sandwiches I've had.  The potato salad was not the same "rock star" status with a somewhat bland taste and it was too runny.  The coleslaw was not bad but not great and it played a better accompaniment to the delicious pastrami sandwich which was the "rock star".  I topped it off with a huge glass of iced tea and I was full for two days afterwards :-)

If you're looking for a really good deli, this is the place!  I look forward to visiting Scott's Generations again soon and try their smoke white fish or belly lox.  I will probably take some pastrami to go ~ it's that good.  I hope to see you there!

I had lunch here last week with Rand H, Mike C and Norm R after wanting to try this place since I moved to AZ a year and a half ago.  I've been missing my favorite Chicago deli and have been craving some good Jew food and I finally found it!  

For lunch I had a brisket sandwich on an onion roll with a side of kishke with gravy. It was excellent!  The beef was tender, flavorful and not dry, and the kishke was sliced,browned and skinless.  This is what I've been waiting for.  

While at our table we had a great view of the deli cases and menu boards and I knew I would have to order some food to go for my Mom and for me.  I ordered the Mish mosh soup and that was just okay - the matzo ball was grainy, the kreplach was mostly dough and there was only one of each and no kasha like I'm used to when I order this soup back home.  The chopped liver was good, my Mom and her husband liked it a lot, but I think Don and Charlie's has the best chopped liver in the Phoenix area.  The best thing I brought home was the belly lox!  If I'm going to eat lox, it's going to be the real thing and taste like lox - not the tasteless nova lox that's served to the masses.  It was wonderful and salty and full of flavor and I have enough left for a sandwich tomorrow morning :)

Overall this is the closes to a real Jewish Deli I've been to here in AZ - and I will for sure be back and try the corned beef/pastrami and potato pancakes next time!

didn't hear from them from my email...bad service, non attentive
wrong items . quality of their food...bottom of the barrel for a Jewish
Deli...wont return

Just had lunch here with a friend. I had the Reuben which was excellent. My friend had the Philly cheesesteak which was so big he took half of it home. The French fries were real fat, crispy and made from real potatoes not frozen junk. I normally don't eat French fries but I cleared my plate of these. On my way out I bought some smoked whitefish and a kasha knish which I had for breakfast the next day and was excellent.

I tried the corned beef on rye. Comes with a pickle and slaw.  The meat was piled high and deliciously tender. The pickle was half sour(how'd they know that's my favorite). The slaw was perfect. I really enjoyed my lunch and was even saddened when it was over-lol!  Can't wait to get back

Being that I am from the east coast and lived in NYC for many years, this is the first time in 4 years living in AZ I felt like I have tasted home.  The chopped liver, pastrami, and corn beef on the same level as the old Carnegie deli. Fries and pickles are superb. Having national mustard is clutch as well. My only issue and it is minor is the rye bread is good but just not that super soft Jewish rye you get in the city, the rest of the meal makes up for the small glitch in the rye bread which I think is an impossible ask unless you bring in the NYC tap water. We will be coming back frequently!

Living in the neighborhood, I've been to Scott's maybe three times. The food is pretty good admittedly but I can never get past the prices or the awful service. You would think that you get your sandwich wrapped in gold leaf.

Miracle Mile deli is good and more reasonable, and frankly I'd rather drive the extra mile. No pun intended. Scott's does not give me ANY reason to return. The service is atrocious. I once stood at the counter for almost 5 minutes before being acknowledged. They should pack up and move back to NY where people are ok being treated like jerks for walking in the door.

Best Breakfast Place Ever!  We wish we lived in Phoenix.  Doesn't look like much when you walk in but boy-oh-boy, we loved it!!  

Got to check it out.  We can't wait to come back to Pheonix.  My hubby is still raving about it, 6 months later.
I had lunch there today. I had the Scottwich. The sandwich was great. The only complaint was that the service was a little slow. I will be back to try the Reuben.

4.5 stars... 
Minus a 1/2 star for the fact that I only experienced take-out and the fact that the kreplach in my soup didn't taste right.  Other than that, this is my new favorite place to get matzo ball soup.  The broth tasted just as good if not better than any I've had before.  The combination of vegetables, dill, seasoning, and fresh chicken soothed my sore throat instantly and warmed me up too!

The menu is HUGE and the cases full of knishes, bagels, rugalach, muffins, smoked fish and more were impressive for the valley.  I noted that they have a section on the menu called "On The Liter Side" for those that are calorie or carb conscious.  I also noticed that they'll make egg white omelettes upon request (and for an additional $1).

I'll have to return to Scott's Generations when I'm feeling better and my appetite is back to normal.  Hopefully that will be soon thanks to the soup I enjoyed today!

After 10yrs in the Valley, I finally found this Little hidden Gem. I honestly have to say its was the best Jewish deli I've been to. No more Subway when I'm craving a sandwich...Its close to the Biltmore area, which is a huge plus for me because its close to home. Just like any Deli its seat yourself type of place with a deli counter for your to-go orders. I luv this spot!!

Food: 5 STARS
I ordered the Pastrami on garlic bread. It had a huge portion of meat covered with Swiss chesse and grilled onions. It also came with homemade fry's and coleslaw. I was very impressed with the size of the meal. IT WAS AMAZING!!!!

Not only do they serve sandwiches, but they had a huge menu from breakfast to entrees. Everything that passed by our table looked great.

SERVICE: 5 STARS
From the moment we walked in ..we were welcomed with a friendly greet...to the moment we were leaving they made sure everything was perfect.

Location: 5 STARS
centrally located in the valley in a nice shopping complex. Next to Ace Hardware.

PRICE: 4 STARS
 $12.50 for Huge Pastrami Sandwich/ Fries/ coleslaw. It was a big portion, but just a tad pricey for lunch price. Take $2.50 off and it would of been a 5 too.

I def will be back all the time with friends and family regardless your pricing... Thank you for the Great Lunch.

The breakfast was gross. Waited 25 minutes for basic breakfast. Apparently the cook doesn't know the difference between American cheese and Cheddar cheese, and has trouble following their own menu. While there, the manager/owner took a call and refused to refund an order for a to go customer who was given the wrong order. He stated he couldn't perform a refund to the credit card, which is a blatant lie, not to mention poor customer service. Should have just come in for a bagel and probably would have been satisfied.
A great New York Style Deli. Huge portions and very tasty food. Breakfast is served all day.

We always enjoyed this restaurant at the old location and like the new location even more! The food is just as good, the service is good, the place feels more spacious and lighting is better! We were pleased before, even more pleased now in their new roomier and brighter digs! Will definitely be back and would highly recommend this delicatessen and restaurant to others! Good coffee too! ;)

I haven't experienced such friendly and good service in such a long time. Our waitress smiled at me and was up beat the whole time (I just don't see that genuine attitude any more) in addition to great service, the breakfast I had was delicious. I had their oatmeal and a side of seasoned fruit. The oatmeal was hearty and I love that my waitress brought me a whole dish of brown sugar (ohhh yee-a). The fruit was sub-par. I got two little pieces of pineapple, and the cantaloupe and honey-due were crunchy. But I'm not too concerned about it, I ate all the fruit and this place is a deli, not a fruit hut. I'm going to come again and branch out to something new - they had a lot of good things on their menu. 

Love this place!

I have been looking for a New York style deli that carries smoked whitefish.  I finally found it at Scott's Generation!  I ordered their whitefish platter.  It was everything that I expected and more! Two large pieces of extremely fresh whitefish that pretty much melted in my mouth! It came with my choice of a bagel, lettuce, tomatoes, onions and pickles. Everything was extremely fresh! My mother had matzoh ball soup and half a corn beef sandwich both were delicious!  The corn beef was extremely lean and worth every bite! I am so excited to know that The cravings I have will be fulfilled at Scott's Generation!

I'm sorry. On a few levels. Needed a breakfast place in the area yesterday and went with Yelp. This is the first time I've been disappointed. with Yelp consensus reviews. 

I love Jewish delis and have learned to "settle" in Phoenix. 

But I'll never settle for Eggs Benedict on a bagel with a slice of Kraft American Process Cheeselike Food Product between the deli ham and the poached egg.  Don't offer something if all you're going to do is mortally insult it's memory!

The coffee at least is the swill I grew up with B.S. [Before Starbucks} - just like I remember in Jewish delis and everywhere for that matter - but that's another rant altogether. 

Meh-be the lox is good. Meh-be the good corned beef is piled sky high. I'll probably never find out.

We used to go to the old place all the time. Unfortunately they've created a cookie cutter sterile establishment. They've raised their prices and it's not as homey as it used to be. The food is still great as always and the wait staff friendly. Unfortunately I missed the New York style booths and comfortableness of the old place.

Very good food, and great service! I ordered a deli sandwich and was pleasantly surprised by the amount of meat on my sandwich. They did skimp on the mayonnaise and sauce so I asked for extra. Will definitely visit again!
Love the restaurant it's a great place great new location. A wonderful fish platter. And great prices for breakfast and no long wait for a table like most places for breakfast

It doesn't get any better than Scott's Generations. Buh-bye Chompie's with your high prices, rude service and dirty restaurants.

My partner desperately wanted a good Jewish deli sandwich and soup. After my last experience at the local chain that offers this type of food I had to find somewhere new. Scott's Generations filled the bill.

They offer HUGE portions at reasonable prices. The restaurant is spotless and the service was the best. You cannot go wrong with Scott's Generations. Wherever you live in the valley it is well worth the drive.

Nice deli with booths to sit in and eat there.  They have a variety of foods from quick lunch food to full on dinners.  This place definitely has a nice deli vibe.  Very good Italian beef.  Greeted with a smile and friendly banter.  Will definitely visit again.

Went here when they were at their old location, but the new place is a HUGE upgrade. Nice and bright, but keeps the deli feel. The sandwiches are filled to the max with meat and the sides are plentiful. Will always come back!

My husband and I ate breakfast here last Sunday and were not disappointed. The place wasn't too busy so it was easy to walk in and grab a table. 

I ordered the hash mash which is corned beef, scrambled eggs, potatoes and cheese in a skillet. It was very filling and delicious. However they did put way too much cheese on top and after a while it become too much. I would order the hash mash again, minus the cheese.

My husband ordered pancakes with a side of bacon. The pancakes were big and fluffy and the bacon was thick and tasty, not fatty and floppy.

I looked at the other items on the menu and everything else sounds great. Lots of deli sandwiches, soups and their desserts look very yummy.
I plan to check them out for lunch or dinner sometime as well as coming back for breakfast.

after reading the ratings I had ethical concerns about management and even patronizing this place, but fortunately, I did not deal with that guy. The lady who took my order was very sweet and the food was fantastic! I got the corned beef hash with white toast. Hash was out of this world with lots of green pepper and onions. Very moist and flavorful. Home fries were were well  seasoned and eggs were cooked perfectly as requested, softly scrambled, which is rare. toast was perfect and I don't even like it that much but Scott's made me a believer. I got to go, but it was ready less than 2 minutes after I arrived, just as I was quoted. Hopefully they heeded the past reviews regarding treatment of their staff; I would really like to try more items with a good conscience. that really matters to me.
Great place to get ny style reubens and pastrami sandwiches.  Great portion reasonable price you will leave full.  They also have bagels but i havent tried them yet.  Im sure they are great.

Was here for breakfast with a group of friends. Neat diner/deli environment. Old school...  

Service was A+. We had an outstanding waitress yet the others would check to make sure our drinks were filled on an ongoing basis. The food...  Wow!  I had the hash which was incredible!  Others at the table had French Toast, salmon, and a scramble. All were delicious. 

The only regret I have is not going to this place while I lived in Phoenix. I'm definitely going back next time in town.

This is hands down my favorite Jewish deli in the Phoenix area. By weakness is bread, and there's is amazing - both their rye and challah are spot on. The only complaint I can think of is they have a habit of not salting their French fries.

starve yourself all day, get really baked, and then go to scotts and order one of their giant, mouth watering, tender sandwhiches.

the sandwhiches are generously loaded with so many different kinds of meat choices you're bound to find something that meets your needs. i'm a big corned beef eater, so i choose the pastrami, corned beef, and turkey sandwhich. my friend ordered the philly cheese.  both were terrific. the fries were crisp and delicious. the coleslaw was some of the best i've had. i also picked up some rugelach in every flavor- so sweet, soft, and delicious - try the chocolate raspberry, you can't go wrong.

we were the only ones in there on a saturday afternoon which was a little weird but made for an easy going dining experience. the interior is reminiscent of many jewish delis back east, with seinfeld playing on the tv and pictures of the owner's family filling the walls.

i'm a sandwhich whore and will definately be coming back for more.

Scott's Generations is a great deli. Generous portions of very fresh everything, arranged in your favrite traditional formats and served by friendly staff.

They should be solid four stars. 

However, they lose one star for forgetting capers on my lox plate and weak weak coffee.

I'll be back to give 'em a second go and maybe another star.

The new location is bigger but less appealing then the old location. I like the bagels in the baskets on the wall much better than in the case.  The food prices are higher but the quality and portions seem to be the same. As always, this is a great deli. I just wish they brought the old ambiance to the new location.

He-uge piles of corned beef on tasty pumpernickel or rye breads.  I had the lox platter with bagel, cream cheese, capers, onions and tomato.  The other 11 people - one had the whitefish platter (huge and tasty), spinach knish (yum), tongue and pastrami omlette (hmmm didn't try that), and many more items at the other end of the table.  No complaints from even the pickiest eaters.  Love the new pickles!  The remodel is great too.  The extra room makes a nice space for groups.

First off, this listing says "Delivery" and all over their website they advertise for delivery. I work 2 blocks away from the store so I thought it would be easy to order some breakfast. I called and was rudely put on hold before even greeted. After 5 minutes of being put on hold I requested to make a delivery order and was put on hold for another 2-3 minutes- when the lady got back on the phone she said "I don't think the delivery driver can deliver right now", I then asked when he will be delivering and her response was "he doesn't feel like it right now. How far are you and I can see if he's back". I told her I was less than 2 blocks away and she put me on about a2 minute hold until she finished the call with "oh maybe I can't find him anymore". ARE YOU SERIOUS? Wow. All I can say I that I will never ever attempt to eat there again, and how unprofessional to advertise all over yelp AND your website if you only delivery "when you feel like it". Rude, unprofessional, unorganized, unwilling and I'm sure he food would have been about as good as their customer service experience. Shit.

Finally moved to a place with a little more space and convenience.  I used to stop in about once every 6-8 weeks, now you can bet I'll be there weekly.  Although not a kosher deli, Scotts has always carried many kosher brands.  Find the pickles you used to get in Brooklyn, or Fox's U-Bet syrup.  I'll be stopping in later to get bagels.

I cannot believe that I never wrote a review for Scott's Generations!  I must stop here once every couple weeks or so.  It would be more often if I was in the neighborhood more...  The have the BEST chopped liver in town.  

I'm not a big knish fan, but one of my friends is.  She drives from Surprise just to get one.  I'm a huge fan of the Reuben sandwiches.

I stop for lunch, but I never go home without a pound of chopped liver, some delicious slaw, and (real chewy) bagels.

My only beef with this place is that they close early.  I can never get here in time for dinner.

For the love of god and all that is holy this is a feast! So one of my fellow yelpers recommended Scott's and today I was searching for somewhere to eat. Hmmm I decided on Scott's after looking at the pics. I thought holy cow that looks fantastic! 

Beware objects are larger than they appear in the pictures! I ordered the Philly with fries. This samich was very good, the steak was tender and juicy the veggies grilled just right and the roll was perfection. I had to take away one star. Sorry Scott fans. The fries were under cooked. They are fat fries and need a little TLC mine were still very firm in the middle. 

The portion is ginormous! I couldn't finish a 4th of it! This will be a splitter next time for sure! 

I will be back soon!

I had a very interesting dining experience at this place last week.  I haven't been there in 20 years, and having lived in LA and NY I was excited to dine at a Jewish Style Deli.
First we walked in and weren't sure if we should seat ourselves.  So we did.  The booths were all torn, but this makes it close to NY authentic.  I almost never see this in AZ.  The guy behind the counter was serving someone and we kept waiting for him to come over and take our order.  Then after about 10-15 minutes the waiter came in from the back door and came over to our table.  It would have been nice if the guy in front told us to take and seat and the waiter will be in soon.  Even better, he should alerted the waiter that there were customers.

When the waiter got to the table he wreaked of cigarette smoke.  He had an odd look on his face.  My friend ordered a coke and myself a diet coke.  When he came back he served me the regular and my friend the diet.  Then my brother asked what diet Dr Brown's sodas they have and he named a few.  My brother ordered one that the waiter just named, and the waiter said they don't have it.  When we told him he had just mentioned it he replied, "oh yeah."  Then 10 seconds later he came back and asked what kind of soda did my brother want since he already forgot.  The food took a really long time to get to the table because I believe he forgot to order the food.

Being from LA, I could tell he was stoned.  My 85 year old mom could tell something was not right about this guy.

He did get the order correct even though he didn't know who ordered what dish.  He also didn't have ketchup  or mustard on the table when the food was placed on the table.  

The food was excellent!  We all enjoyed it very much.  Best Jewish style deli in the Phoenix area, in my opinion.

Because the food was so good, and he did get all the correct dishes, I will give this place 2 stars for my dining experience.  If we just had better service I would have given it 5 stars.  Even though the food was so delicious, it was hard to enjoy it given the circumstances.

I though all week about the the "Ruben Ruben" and the other sandwiches I saw on "Check Please" AZ. We had a cup of the Beet Borscht & a cup of the Chicken Noodle. The Chicken Noodle had a totally new taste and my wife asked to trade for the Beet Borscht (cold and tasted like pickled beet soup). I couldn't recommend either . Since when is a Philly Cheese Steak made with machined sliced roast beef,  cooked onions & green peppers? You know you are in the wrong place when the "cold" slaw is the same temperature as the "baked" french fries. The $12.50 Ruben Ruben is a good sized sandwich with dry and un-flavorful pastrami. I had to add mustard and a shake of salt to make it taste like a Ruben. The service was s-l-o-w, and no one asked if we enjoyed our food. Guess they didn't have to since our plates were only missing a couple fries and the warm cold slaw was untouched.We had doctored our sandwiches with condiments so I saw no reason to not take them home.

We went to Scott's Generation for the first time today. The menu was very exhaustive and had options that would please everyone. Our party ordered the patty melt, the combo Rueben which was both pastrami and corned beef, and the smothered chicken. All of these dishes were delicious and had such large portion sizes that all of us took leftovers home. I would highly recommend.

One of the best places for breakfast. We used to live within walking distance and we would have breakfast here frequently. Scott's rivals Chompies with large hearty breakfasts with quicker and better service.

We usually stick to omelets. They are giant, overstuffed, kinda greasy but good. The home fries are some of the best in the city. And all the egg dishes include the option of a bagel with cream cheese. Their bagels are awesome. 

After filling your belly with goodness, stop by Karsh's next door to take some pastries home for later.

What can I say.....the best hot pastrami on rye you can get in the southwest!  My wife had the French dip and was extremely happy with it. New location with great vibes and their updated menu is great!  I'll be back over and over.

I wanted to post a review on the waitress we had for Smunch yesterday, Nancy, but it looks like I can only review a business so I'll just update this one.

When I walked into Scott's this week and asked if I could make a reservation for a large group during Saturday brunch hours, they said no problem without any hesitation. When organizing Smunch every month, this is a lovely thing to hear. 

The table was already set up and ready when I arrived and people started gathering shortly after. We wanted separate checks, though not all separate and Nancy didn't miss a beat. She was amazing. And hilarious. She joked with us the entire time and told us of her serious karaoke schedule.

At one point, someone at our table got up for a minute, and shortly after their food came out. Nancy just sat right down and pretended to eat it. And let us capture photographic evidence. 

I now will come back more frequently. And sit in Nancy's section every single time.

OMG: Found on google maps.  SO GLAD WE DID. This is authentic folks.  Service was great, friendly and attentive. The food was fabulous, more than filling (we had enough for dinner later).  Generous portions of good, mouthwatering deliriousness....  Thank you for a wonderful first time experience.  IF YOU ARE IN THE PHOENIX AREA, THIS IS A MUST STOP FOR LUNCH.   I wish I had discovered for breakfast and dinner.  Such nice staff...........
Really great little NY deli in Phoenix. And thank goodness we found it because we were really missing a good bagel:)

I can't believe I had never been here before! New York Deli at its finest! The food is delicious and fresh, and amazing staff! They have a wonderful selection of bagels, knishs', and my favorite apricot linzer cookies! The Cubano sandwich was delicious, and will be trying the corned beef hash next! Cheers and happy dining!

A Delicious Deli in Central Phoenix. Who knew? Apparently a lot of people, because Scott's Generations Restaurant & Delicatessen has been in this part of town for quite a while. And the quality of the fare and the service is probably why.

Scott's is a pretty standard New York deli, overall. I can't say that there are any really unique offerings here, but everyone in my group enjoyed their meals. Like any Deli, the food is plentiful, and diners will most likely be heading home with leftovers.

The server was awesome. Really friendly and quick. The staff didn't show any annoyance with my 3-year-old daughter not wanting to sit still before she got her meal. She wasn't loud or rambunctious, but was getting in the way some of the time. They just smiled and moved around her. A nice woman at the counter even came over and gave her a cookie.

The only negative I can think of is that Scott's isn't open for dinner. I'm not in this part of town very often during business hours, and it's a bit out of the way to just grab some breakfast or lunch. The bakery selections in the counter display also weren't overly tempting, but I didn't have any room for desert, anyway. Maybe next time. If you grew up eating Deli like I did, then this is a must-try restaurant.

Omg. MOLD, mold everywhere!!!! 

I bought two potato filled pastry's we get 3/4 through eating them and my boyfriend goes "Is that mold" we then pick the pastry shell apart and the entire thing is filled with thick black mold. This was hours after they were purchased! 

In about an hour we were both feeling sick, I threw up which was terrible. I'm posting a picture of the nasty moldy food we got. I'm shocked. I eat out everyday and have NEVER EVER had an experience like this. 

I ordered Borsch off the menu as well, and they were out so he just opened a can they had on the shelf and added tap water (for $8.95) I have to say one word...

HORRIFIED!

Scott's Generations is a real deal Jewish style deli ala New York. The only thing missing is the ready to eat hot dog grill. Sandwiches come with cole slaw and ample servings of piping hot french fries which tend to be over cooked at times. In general a delicious and delightful throwback to the New York of my youth.

The sandwiches are as big as your head and the bagels are always fresh! I come here as often as I can and I love the people! 

This is a great place and it's a fun place to bring the family and/or group. 

Best in town!

First time eating at Scott's. Location is good, lots of seating. We had a meet up group meet there. Was able to seat 12 of us.

I ordered the Scott's Reuben with corned beef. Came with coleslaw, pickles and fries. 
I Loved it. the sandwich was huge and I took half home. The fries and pickles were great. But the coleslaw was amazing. I usually don't like coleslaw and theirs tasted Delish.

Service was really good also.

Love the Matzo ball soup!!!  My daughter got the kids chicken tenders with FF and for a selective eater she loved every bite!  Next time I will bring Pastrami lovin hubby to score the deli meat selection.  I was tempted by the bakery items and knishes which I will also have to give a try so I will definitely be back!  Clean, with courteous prompt service is an added plus to the great food.

Boyfriend and I were in the mood for a quick yummy lunch and he brought me here. Its an old school diner feel with older cute women that wait on you. To be honest, I wasn't particularly impressed with the layout and some of the deli choices (it didn't seem like the cleanest place to me) but the service was sweet and the food was ok. 

The decor is kind of funny, it definitely embraces "generations" as it has old wedding photos and family photos on the wall. 

We both had pastrami sandwiches but I had only a half with some soup and boyfriend had the whole. The soup was really thick with veggies and meat. The flavoring wasn't my favorite but boyfriend really liked it. The sandwich was good, but a bit greasy and HUGE. This is definitely the place to go when you have a hangover. We could have split the one sandwich since it was so huge. I was able to eat about 1/4 of it since they give you massive chunky fries and cole slaw.

I saw some other people getting different things and it looked good so I would come back to try some other items but this isn't my number one favorite place by any means.

I probably would have rated this a 3-3.5 but the older ladies were just so sweet.

A prompt, attentive service, and good Jewish deli will have me returning soon.
I discovered this place when I went to get something at Ace Hardware.
I noticed that they served breakfast all day, so I went inside the restaurant.
I was seated right away and within minutes, I was given a glass of water.
My server was friendly and accommodating.
I was in a hurry, and without carefully looking at the menu, I decided to order the vegetarian skillet.
It was okay, but I wish I had ordered something else.
I do not like potatoes and onions in my omelet skillet.
The restaurant is welcoming, and the walls are full of wedding and family pictures. It looks like it's a family owned and operated business. That's very nice and special.
I will go back and try something else, but next time I will read the menu.

I really want to support this long-standing neighborhood restaurant, however, I was disgusted by how dirty it is.  I watched a waitress rub her nose and touch her hair and then handle food (moved it around on the plate). I watched another waitress holding plates of food passed to her from the kitchen and it (the food) was touching the underside of the shelf which was filthy. I don't think the menus have ever been washed nor the walls.  Really disgusting.  And don't expect to be greated when you walk in.

The food was excellent.  i had the pastrami Reuben, which was probably the best pastrami that I've had in AZ, very flavorful.  The fries and pickles were excellent too.  Fresh cut fries, can't beat that!

I also had a potato knish.  I haven't had a lot of knishes in my life so i don't have a lot to compare this one too, but It was good.  The only complaint I would have is that the potatoes weren't very moist, but it was still flavorful with a very nice flaky crust.

The only negative thing I would say about this place was that the day I went it was 90 degrees and out and they didn't have the AC on!  We asked the server about it and she said the owner didn't want to turn the air on yet.  I mean, it was ridiculously hot inside that place!  So hopefully that was an isolated incident because the food was so good I can't wait to go back!

I feel basically the same way as Stevey; one problem, we had a roach crawl across the table and behind the picture frame on the wall (although, it wasn't too bad... the picture was of a heavily mulleted Italian man circa 1981, though I see that being insult to injury to those less appreciative of bad 80's fashion) last time. BIG turn off. The man won't go there with me anymore. I can't find a better chocolate egg cream though...

My buddy and I swung by for lunch to go. We were hoping for a quick sandwich, but the service was very slow. We each got the turkey over-stuffed sandwich. Because of the description, we were expecting larger sandwiches, but they weren't big. There was plenty of meat on the sandwiches, however. The coleslaw was tasty but was a little too runny for me. The Yelp deal really saved the day because I don't feel that the sandwiches warranted their $12 price. Anyhow, it seems like a fine place, but it's much slower than your standard deli.

Best corned beef in Arizona hands Down the sandwiches are big enough to share.  The place is what a typical deli should be and trust me I know delis. They have everything you can imagine on the menu.  The pictures on the wall are priceless and look like they have been there 30+ years.

I was craving some real NY/Jewish deli, so hubby and I decided to head over there this afternoon.  I'm so glad we did, because my cravings were all satisfied.

We split the chopped liver w/bagel chips.  I ended up eating most of it (plus taking some home), because it's just not hubby's "thing".  But, it was delicious!!  Unfortunately, the bagel chips weren't really from bagels I like.  Most of them were sunflower seed bagels, and I'd prefer just plain or onion. 

I had the brisket sandwich on an onion roll, and it was everything I could've wanted.  The brisket was juicy and tasty, so I didn't have to add anything to it.  Plus, I ended up bringing home enough of the extra meat to make another sandwich.  My hubby had the reuben, and gobbled it down so fast, I don't think I actually saw it on his plate.

I also ordered a side of kugel, which he'd never had.  And, it was warm, sweet and creamy.  I was surprised my hubby liked it, because he doesn't usually like anything with raisins.

To me, this is my comfort food.  It reminds me of my family back east, and I'm so glad my husband has embraced it like he has.

This was actually the 2nd time we've been here, and both times have been successes.  They're a bit out of the way for us, but sometimes, ya just gotta have your deli!!

The food and service at Scott's Generations was excellent. We had sandwiches (corned beef, tongue) and soup. The sandwiches were very large and extremely tasty. The rye bread was nice and fresh.  I also couldn't leave without 1 of the black & whites in the display case. I've never had one so fresh and soft. Overall - best NY deli food I've had in Phoenix area (though Chompie's has a much more extensive menu and is open for dinner). 

Only 1 sour note:  They refused to honor the 2017 Entertainment coupon (buy 1 entree get 1 free, up to $14) until I put up a strong protest. The only notice that they will no longer honor Entertainment coupons (book or phone app) is a small piece of paper hanging at the cash register, and of course no one will see it there until they have finished eating, which is extremely unfair and essentially deceitful.

I love this place, we actually went twice this weekend!  

They have some veggie options on the menu which is nice, and they are happy to change anything around to make it vegetarian if you'd like.  The service is friendly and the prices are great.  

The meat eaters at my table said that the meats were fantastic and we all left very happy!

I first started coming here in the early 90's. Used to come by once or twice a month for lunch.  The last time I was  here was some time in 2009.
Today my wife and I were in the neighborhood and the sign caught my eye. I was excited to come in again. "WAS"

Beautiful day so we decided to sit outside. Abouot 7 or 8 tables out on the patio. All were dirty, some still with plates on them. All had crumbs and small bits of food, most all had ashes on them. We picked the cleanest one and wiped it and cleaned it ourselves.  Waitress came and we both ordered good-rare roast beef. The kind we remebered from NY.

My kaiser roll was dry and crumbly-falling apart. Should have chosen the rye like my wife-can't beat it.  Went to put pepper on the sandwich and had to get a pepper shaker from another table that wasn't dirty. Found one after the fourth table.

Sorry Scott!  Used to LOVE coming here. Was very dissapointed. I'll probably come back, but no way I can get the wife back.

Great food, just need to "clean up" a little.

To be honest, their foods taste really good and the waiter are nice, but the big guy at front door cashier is not very nice and had no patient to the first time visitor!

So I give them 3 stars! I can tolerate bad foods once or twice, but I can't tolerate bad customer service!

Dined here a few times for breakfast and lunch. Nothing to be too impressed by. The food is generally greasy, the tables dirty, and the service definitely lack-luster. 

The only reason I went in the first place was because my friend bragged about how awesome the place was. I left unimpressed.

Bottom line: Scott's has a matzo ball soup so good I can't imagine how anyone could ever hate the Jews. Best bagels in Phoenix, hands down. Take your Einstein's and shove it.
Scott's has an expansive menu that ranges across breakfast, traditional deli offerings, and a strong but semi random assortment of 'home cooking' type meals that your mom makes but you never see in restaurants. I haven't spent a lot of time in delis in New York, but Scott's reminds me of the "New York deli" I used to live around the corner from in Houston, down the street from the JCC - tasty, simple, and unapologetic, about anything. I love their soups, although their pastrami is not the best I've ever had. They have every flavor of Dr Brown's imaginable. The portions are huge - too huge, actually. I'm minuscule, so the prospect of a sandwich that is 3x what I can eat in one sitting is daunting to the point that I only go if I know I can take a box home. The service runs hot and cold, but I've never not gotten what I wanted the way I wanted it, and if the waitress isn't looking at me with vague disapproval, I feel like it's not an authentic New York experience.
The ruebans are decent, but not worth the 12.50 they charge.  Service is great though.
This place is awesome. The food is exceptional, huge portions, and friendly service. Never disappoints!

New to the area so am trying out all the places near me. Scott's Generations Deli & Restaurant was on my agenda for today. Do I know anything about NY delis and matza balls? No. ( I cannot even spell matza ball). Do I know anything about ordering meats or deli fish? No. I'll just review what I know. And I know design, good service and breakfast food. Design of the place including the logo and menu...Stale and dated. Quality of the service...quite excellent. My eggs Benedict... Very average. After I got over the shock of a cheese slice somehow showing up sandwiched in between each English muffin and the hollandaise sauce, I did enjoy it and the home fries. Obviously not the best hollandaise, and I guess they know this already because it needed to taste more like cheese and less like hollandaise according to the cooks that probably should just remove this item instead of pretending. But what the heck...it was something different. Next time I'll order a Reuben and see if my 3 stars can become 4.
This is a deli.  It's a phenomenal deli.  Breakfast and lunch, it's always spot on.  Whenever I get a craving for corned beef or pastrami, this is my go to spot.  Great for breakfast too.

The food was all right. I had the Steak and Eggs for breakfast with toast and home fries ($12.95). The best part about it is the home fries. My steak was supposed to be well done and it was .. but only on half of it. The other half looked medium rare. The food was overall okay.

Fantastic food in a wonderful new space 
Locally owned for 28 years by three generations

This is almost a 5 star.  The place was clean, quiet, well lit, and the rest room spiffy.  The server was very attentive and friendly the specials good but was not crazy about the taters.  The most unpleasant thing I can say was the grubby long hair on the one guy who looked like he rolled out of bed.  I am very surprised he was not asked to wear a hair net.    Will return hopefully when the long haired guy is off.

Scott, I was very surprised to  hear that the "Coffee with a Cop" meeting was to be held at Scott's Generations.  As a matter of fact when I inquired if Ofc. Michael C. Piazza was aware of the limited space he informed me that you have a large back room that is offered for meetings and groups.  How great is that:-)  Just goes to show that the Police Officers are on top of everything, LOL.  Hope you have a large turn out and especially for the coffee with a Cop.  A special thank you to all the police men and women that put their lives on the line ever day for us.  Be safe and remember any thing that looks suspicious might turn out to be just do not use the emergency number to report anything that might not be an emergency and let the non emergency officer taking the call decide if you are not sure. 

Coffee With the Cop

Date: June 14th, 2017
Location: Scotts Generations
742 E. Glendale Ave. #142
Time: 8:00 am--9:00 am
I had the Pastrami sandwich. I think it's called the Scott-wich. It was delicious! Moist and a heaping amount of meat. Super stuffed! Will be coming here again.

I've heard about this place before, and finally stopped in with a friend today for lunch. I'm on a deli kick as of late, and have been craving Gefilte fish like crazy.  I liked it over all, but I must admit, HOW DOES A DELI (THE SECOND ONE AT THAT THIS WEEKEND) RUN OUT OF GEFILTE FISH AND BEET BORSCT?!  HOW? WHY?

I have to say, that was all I wanted. Odd? not to me.  So, off I went scouring the menu for other items.  I will say, the waiter was extremely knowledgeable and explained that all that sort of stuff comes from New York and as of recently, there's been "issues" getting their hands on this stuff? Is there a gefilte fish strike going on somewhere? A beet farmer protest that I don't know about? SERIOUSLY?!?!?

Overall Robyn and I had a great time here. We really enjoyed our food, the service was great and it went really well.  I would eat here again, but I would insist on them having Gefilte fish before I go.....(ok ok I'm just kidding, but seriously, I need gefilte fish.....)

learned about this place from Check Please, and glad I did. They are located in a strip mall that I normally wouldn't consider when looking for a place to eat out. It is a hole in the wall, but in the best sense of the phrase. 
On a Sun early afternoon service was friendly and very attentive.
Ordered the corned beef hash which is made fresh and the Reuben. Both were substantial portions...always nice to know dinner for that night is taken care of already.
Food was very good and priced competitively for the amount of food. Scott's Deli is serious competition to Chompies

Scott's has the best deli in Arizona.  It's actual New York deli the way they prepare in NYC. I would know. I am a New York deli connoisseur. Scott's has it down perfectly to mentio the best service and best coffee!!!

From the moment I sat down I was greeted with a great ice tea and amazing choices. I chose the Ruben hands down one of if not the best Ruben I have ever had. The flavor was second to none the portions were beyond my expectations. The Russian dressing was house made and was perfect it complemented the amazing brisket. The fries were the best crisp outside soft inside and so flavor full.  And to finish the meal a black and white cookie the was moist and so much flavor like a sugar cookie was paired with a cupcake. I wish I would have bought more. If you haven't been here you are missing the best food in Phoenix.

Best New York deli I've found in Phoenix, reminds me of Art's Deli in Studio City, Los Angeles.  Always spotless, very lean meats, reasonable prices, friendly staff and lots of easy parking.   It's consistently excellent food and service.

Very disappointing.  I was looking forward to a lox breakfast, but I don't eat farmed salmon.  So of course I had to ask if the lox was from farmed or wild salmon.  The server checked with the kitchen and it is farmed!  No lox for me.  I then asked about the chicken livers; "are they organic?"  I thought the waitress was going to burst out laughing but she quickly composed herself and just lightly shook her head.  Okay, I'm a fuss bucket, I just can't eat nitrates, hormones, preservatives, etc.  I ordered a bagel and wished I had just gone to TJ and picked up some wild Alaskan lox, organic eggs, organic bread, organic butter and I would have gotten it all for the price of their lox & eggs breakfast plate with plenty of quality food stuffs for 4 other meals.  I think this place is past it's due date, old school, no growth and just getting by on low grade food stock and laughing all the way to the bank.

I was craving lox so I made my first trip to Scott's Generations.  Got there at 12:30pm on a Sunday and it was super quiet, just about five other people in there.  The setup is classic diner/deli; leather booths, good American easy listening/classic rock playing in the background.  I can see how some people might say the place is dirty but if you've ever been to a NYC deli...it's not anything shocking or out of the ordinary.  Didn't bother me at all.

I ordered the L.E.O Special - lox, eggs, onions and a bagel.  The board menu can be a bit overwhelming with tons of options, so I was glad I took a look at the menu before I got there.  Ordered my food to go and it was ready in 10 minutes.  

BUT - the black and white cookies are fake.  The icing is that store bought crap just spread on the cookie.  Any true b&w cookie connoisseur will be able to tell just by looking at them that they won't taste the same as the real deal.  I tried just to make sure and was correct.

Overall I was satisfied with the food and experience.  Not amazing, but not horrible.  I'd go back - not a lot of places to find lox here.  And they have Knishes.  I'll try that next.

I called in an order last week for breakfast.  I ordered corn beef hash with eggs, potato pancake, and bagel.
They asked how I wanted my eggs cooked.  I told them fried with whites cooked but yellows dippy.
They got the whites mostly OK but the yellows were not dippy.  Had I been eating in I would have told them to take them back and cook them right.
I have had their pastrami sandwiches and they are delicious.  Next time I will go elsewhere for eggs.  But I will order my sandwiches there or "maybe not".
Also the owner, Scott, was not very hospitable.  If I were running a business I would be much more friendly and outgoing with my clients.  Everyone likes to be greeted with a smile and a "how ya doing? and "come back again".

Hands down the best ALL DAY breakfast menu in the Phoenix area. I went with the French toast and there wasn't a crumb leftover. Also, had to snag some Passover macaroons since they were only available at this time of year and Scott's has the best!! The owner exemplified amazing customer service and personality. I'll be back soon!

Got a hankering for NY-style deli, so I searched a Yelp, finding Scott's Generations.  Drove from Surprise to midtown Phx to give it a try.  I highly recommend this place.   I had a Ruben that was to die for..  it was truly enough for 2 meals, the meat was stacked so thick.  The better half had the yummy patty melt.  Their home-made coleslaw was xlnt, even better than my mom's.  (Sorry mom).  I like my fries crisp, and the wife like likes her's limply. Although they were more of a potato wedge, (vs a fry)they were piping hot & cooked each to our own liking.  We will definitely be back, it's worth the drive.

Had Scott's Special Corned Beef Hash, and an asiago bagel.

The hash was delicious! Good amount of peppers and onions.

Would go back.

Huge portions! A sandwich can feed 2 people if you're around the 150lb mark. Hence the $14 price point. Boyfriend and I saw this on YELP and went for it. It's GREAT. Staff was amazing and accommodating. Definitely recommend this
Place. Serves breakfast and salads and sandwiches. Thomas M was our server and I couldn't have been more please with our experience.

We came here based on a friend's recommendation about their corned beef hash.  Their recommdation was spot on!   It was absolutely great.

The place is very new clean and bright inside. The menu has lots of options and everything it's reasonably priced.

In short this place is real keeper!

The food is fine, if you actually get the order you've requested AND it's made to order the way you've requested. I've tried to do this twice and both times, my orders were not correct and the owner threw a fit about doing requests that they clearly say they are OK with honoring. The service is awful, the employees are so rude, and they don't give change. They just expect a tip on top of their delivery charge. I will never deal with them again. They clearly enjoy telling the customer they're wrong and don't care about customer service.

I love Scott's Generations. When I am in need of excellent east coast deli food, instead of buying a plane ticket I go to Scott's. The food is wonderful. The staff is great.  The food is not just good for my stomach it is good for my soul.  I'm there every Monday.

Scott is here almost all the time. I've eaten at Scott's since they opened and have never been disappointed. Scott makes the best LEO (lox, eggs & onions) in Phoenix, has lox spread to die for, and is picky about his bagel supplier. I love the knishes and smoked fishes. He even remembers I don't eat meat. This is also my go-to place for a take-out brunch spread.
Not happy since they moved service not as good and twice now take out was cold and wrong.   Sad to see it going downhill , bigger not always better

the only thing special about this place is that you walk in from Arizona and end up in new jersey. or staten island. it is essentially an average tri state area Jewish diner, complete with surly wait staff who fight over, in front of you, whether one of them had taken their table. i eat here when I really need a diner breakfast because I'm homesick. otherwise, the food is not great. the pastrami is sliced super thin and ends dry in the sandwich. and it came lukewarm. who cares if there's a lot of it if it's no good? the breakfasts are bland, and their home fries are mushy and tasteless. and their waitstaff need to learn to get food to the table while it's hot, because I've never received a hot meal here.

I do like their bialys, I'm not sure where else in Phoenix you could find those. even in new York, it's hard to find a place with bialys. save yourself the trouble and get one to go though.

One of the few delis I've seen that serves mish-mosh, which is basically every kind of Jewish chicken soup at once.  It was filling, but not the best: not enough chicken, and that mostly hiding in the bottom of the bowl.  While the noodles and rice were good, there was a bit much of them, and the matzo ball was both small and hard, and it had herbs or something in it, which doesn't really work.  No kreplach, so it hardly even qualified as real mish-mosh.

I came back another day in hopes of trying a sandwich, but it was closed for the day due to a death in the family.  Sorry to hear that.

One thing I liked very much: they serve their soup and other lunch foods at breakfast-time.
OMG the best Reuben in Phoenix hands down!! Owner is very attentive and it's family owned. Great authentic deli, love it!!

I paid $26 dollars for two bagel sandwhiches with lox and the works.  Highway robbery.  They are good, don't get me wrong.  But this is outrageous.  At the most I can see maybe $7 or even $8 but my god....  Well it was delicious but I could easily just go to einstein bagels or all the rest and be just as happy, especially happy for my wallet, it smarts right now.

When it comes to being Jewish, I'm more ish than Jew... a fellow Heeb nearly dropped dead when I didn't know what a "black & white" was.  I can not-so-boldy tell you I have never had gefilte fish... and God-willing, I never will.  That being said, there are probably all sorts of layers to the onion that is Scott's Generations that I haven't peeled back.  And while I haven't embraced many Heeb traditions --- one thing I dig is the food.  And friends, Generations has the food.

If you're there during lunch, this place gets slammed.  There are roughly a bajillion types of sandwiches, some pastas, you name it.  I'm a half-sandwich and matzoh ball soup guy.

One thing: I can't get the feeling the service here is a little subpar.  Plenty of silver-haired, no-nonsense souls roam the dining room... and they're so nice (and old) that you'll feel guilty correcting them when they screw up.  We got a salad yesterday with no dressing and missing some key ingredients.  When we asked if dressing came on it, she said, "Oh, you wanted dressing?  You didn't ask for any."

I'm not one to rip on service -- I think this is the first I've mentioned it in any review -- but c'mon.  Are we being high maintenance for thinking dressing should come on salads?  Are we rabbits?

Overall --- still the best Jewish deli in town and a great place to go when you need a little deli in your belly.   Calorie counters need not apply.

Bubbie would be proud.
